The Cabinet had before' them a Memorandum bythe Chancellor of the Exchequer, covering a minute by the Financial Secretary to the Treasury in regardto a proposal for a single Annual Register of Electors(Paper CP.-100 (25)), and a Memorandum by the HomeSecretary raising objection tb the proposed ohange(Paper CP.-125 (25)).The Cabinet agreed (by a majority) (a; That legislation should be introduced to authorise the preparation of asingle Annual Register of Electorsin place of the two half-yearlyRegisters:(b) That provision should be made in theBill for shortening the qualifyingperiod for a vote from six months to three months:(c) That the Home Secretary and any other minister concerned, in consultationwith the Chancellor of the Exchequer,should prepare a Bill to give effeotto these decisions, and should takeadvantage of this opportunity to remedy certain small defects of administrative machinery which have developed in the working of the representation of the People Act,1918.
